alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 7:43AM PST until January 13 at 4:16PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain over the Central cascades will come to an end this afternoon. The Snohomish River near Monroe will reach flood stage late this afternoon and crest tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snohomish River Near Monroe. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, the Snohomish River will cause minor flooding of low pasture lands and several roads near the river. A stage of 15 feet at this location corresponds to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood Warning System. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 15.9 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 345 PM PST.
